qas.question: When did the first industrial revolution merge into the second?
What caused technological and economical progress?

answers.text: development of steam-powered ships and railways

qas.question: The 19th century was also known as?

answers.text: the internal combustion engine and electric power generation.

qas.question: What was the second industrial revolution was labeled?

context: The first Industrial Revolution merged into the Second Industrial Revolution <a0_0>around 1850<a0_0/>, when technological and economic progress gained momentum with the <a1_0>development of steam-powered ships and railways<a1_0/>, and later in the 19th century with <a2_0>the internal combustion engine and electric power generation.<a2_0/> The Second Industrial Revolution was a phase of the Industrial Revolution; labeled as the <a3_0>separate Technical Revolution<a3_0/>. From a technological and a social point of view there is no clean break between the two. Major innovations during the period occurred in the chemical, electrical, petroleum, and steel industries. Specific advancements included the introduction of oil fired steam turbine and internal combustion driven steel ships, the development of the airplane, the practical commercialization of the automobile, mass production of consumer goods, the perfection of canning, mechanical refrigeration and other food preservation techniques, and the invention of the telephone.
